alert.note: Alert for Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:31PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ulster County through 800 PM EDT... At 731 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Willowemoc, or 11 miles northeast of Liberty, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Denning, Ladleton, Turnwood, Frost Valley, Branch, Oliverea, Belle Ayr, Seager and Hardenburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for east central New York.
